overview: From 2025-07-06 to 2025-07-13, elizaos/eliza had 59 new PRs (52 merged), 6 new issues, and 17 active contributors.

topIssues.title: Fails to load @elizaos/plugin-openai and @elizaos/plugin-bootstrap on Windows
topIssues.author: gcbsumid
topIssues.body: **Describe the bug** On 1.0.17, when I run `elizaos dev` on windows (powershell 7), it tries to load openai plugin (1.0.6) and bootstrap (1.0.15) but it fails to do so using all relevant strategies. It tries to install the plugin, succeeds to install, but fails to load it still. Because it can't load openai and bootstrap plugin, it doesn't process any messages sent to it. However, it's able to find @elizaos/plugin-sql so I'm not sure what the difference is. **To Reproduce** On windows (powershell 7), create a new project and run 'elizaos dev' **Expected behavior** I expect it to load the plugins so that it can handle the messages send from the chat. **Screenshots** **Additional context** I'm on Windows Powershell 7. WSL is installed. I don't have this issue when I run it on my Ubuntu Linux VM. I cloned the eliza repo and ran 'bun install', 'bun run build' and 'bun start' and it's able to load everything on Windows Powershell 7. So it seems this is only failing when I try running the elizaos commands from a project, but not from the eliza repo itself.

topIssues.title: Fix JSDoc parameter mismatches in core package
topIssues.author: SYMBaiEX
topIssues.body:
## Description

Several JSDoc comments in the core package have parameter names that don't match the actual function signatures, causing documentation warnings during the build process.

## JSDoc Issues Found

### 1. DatabaseAdapter.getRoomsByIds
- **File**: `packages/core/src/database.ts`
- **Issue**: JSDoc says `@param roomId` but the parameter is `roomIds` (plural)
- **Current JSDoc**:
```typescript
/**
 * Retrieves the room ID for a given room, if it exists.
 * @param roomId The UUID of the room to retrieve.
 * @returns A Promise that resolves to the room ID or null if not found.
 */
abstract getRoomsByIds(roomIds: UUID[]): Promise<Room[]  < /dev/null |  null>;
```

### 2. DatabaseAdapter.createRooms
- **File**: `packages/core/src/database.ts`
- **Issue**: JSDoc mentions `@param roomId` but the method only takes `rooms: Room[]`
- **Current JSDoc**:
```typescript
/**
 * Creates a new rooms with an optional specified ID.
 * @param roomId Optional UUID to assign to the new room.
 * @returns A Promise that resolves to the UUID of the created rooms.
 */
abstract createRooms(rooms: Room[]): Promise<UUID[]>;
```

### 3. DatabaseAdapter.setCache
- **File**: `packages/core/src/database.ts`
- **Issue**: JSDoc incorrectly lists `@param params` when the method takes `key` and `value` as separate parameters
- **Current JSDoc**:
```typescript
/**
 * Sets a value in the cache with the given key.
 * @param params Object containing the cache key and value
 * @param key The key to store the value under
 * @param value The string value to cache
 * @returns Promise resolving to true if the cache was set successfully
 */
abstract setCache<T>(key: string, value: T): Promise<boolean>;
```

### 4. decryptedCharacter
- **File**: `packages/core/src/specs/v2/settings.ts`
- **Issue**: JSDoc documents `@param runtime` but this parameter is not used in the function
- **Current JSDoc**:
```typescript
/**
 * Decrypts sensitive data in a Character object
 * @param {Character} character - The character object with encrypted secrets
 * @param {IAgentRuntime} runtime - The runtime information needed for salt generation
 * @returns {Character} - A copy of the character with decrypted secrets
 */
export function decryptedCharacter(character: Character, runtime: IAgentRuntime): Character {
```

### 5. v1.formatMessages
- **File**: `packages/core/src/specs/v1/messages.ts`
- **Issue**: JSDoc lists `@param messages` and `@param actors` as separate parameters, but the function takes a single object parameter
- **Current JSDoc**:
```typescript
/**
 * Format messages into a string
 * @param messages - list of messages
 * @param actors - list of actors
 * @returns string
 */
export const formatMessages = ({ messages, actors }: { messages: Memory[]; actors: Actor[] }) => {
```

### 6. v2.encryptedCharacter
- **File**: `packages/core/src/specs/v2/settings.ts` (likely)
- **Issue**: Similar to decryptedCharacter, JSDoc mentions `@param runtime` that's not used

## Build Warnings

These issues cause the following warnings during documentation build:
```
@elizaos/docs:dev: [warning] The signature DatabaseAdapter.getRoomsByIds has an @param with name "roomId", which was not used
@elizaos/docs:dev: [warning] The signature DatabaseAdapter.createRooms has an @param with name "roomId", which was not used
@elizaos/docs:dev: [warning] The signature DatabaseAdapter.setCache has an @param with name "params", which was not used
@elizaos/docs:dev: [warning] The signature decryptedCharacter has an @param with name "runtime", which was not used
@elizaos/docs:dev: [warning] The signature v1.formatMessages has an @param with name "messages", which was not used
@elizaos/docs:dev: [warning] The signature v1.formatMessages has an @param with name "actors", which was not used
@elizaos/docs:dev: [warning] The signature v2.encryptedCharacter has an @param with name "runtime", which was not used
```

## Proposed Solution

Update all JSDoc comments to accurately reflect the actual function parameters. This will improve documentation accuracy and eliminate build warnings.

## Priority

Medium - These are documentation issues that don't affect functionality but do impact documentation quality and cause build warnings.

topIssues.title: If you include "DM" in your user name and chat over an AgentServer socket, then agents will never ignore
topIssues.author: 0xFlicker
topIssues.body: **Describe the bug** If you include "DM" in your name while talking to an ElizaOS agent over that standard AgentServer, the agent will interpret the conversation as a DM and always respond. - **AgentServer**: https://github.com/elizaOS/eliza/blob/develop/packages/server/src/socketio/index.ts#L285 - **plugin-bootstrap**: https://github.com/elizaOS/eliza/blob/develop/packages/plugin-bootstrap/src/index.ts#L274-L279 **To Reproduce** You would need to have a custom socket server or hack the www page at https://github.com/elizaOS/eliza/blob/develop/packages/client/src/lib/socketio-manager.ts#L552 to modify the user name. **Expected behavior** I don't expect an agent to make this kind of decision simple based on a senderName. There are types available to infer room intent. Recommend removing the senderName check here: https://github.com/elizaOS/eliza/blob/develop/packages/server/src/socketio/index.ts#L285

topPRs.title: feat: implement comprehensive documentation overhaul with two-track system
topPRs.author: SYMBaiEX
topPRs.body:
## Summary

This PR implements a comprehensive documentation overhaul addressing issue #5234, creating a two-track documentation system that serves both simple users ("vibecoders") and developers with distinct, focused experiences.

## Key Features Implemented

### ðŸŽ¯ Two-Track Documentation Architecture
- **Simple Track**: Streamlined quick-start guides for non-technical users
- **Technical Track**: Deep technical documentation for developers
- **Customize Track**: Advanced customization and plugin development guides

### ðŸš€ Enhanced User Experience
- **Glass Morphism Design System**: Modern, polished UI with smooth animations
- **Smart Search**: AI-powered search with contextual suggestions
- **Improved Navigation**: Clear separation between user types and content tracks
- **RSS Integration**: Fixed RSS button styling to match GitHub button design

### ðŸ“š Content Improvements
- **Restructured FAQ**: Comprehensive answers addressing common issues
- **Updated Configuration**: Environment variable standardization and examples
- **Better API Documentation**: Enhanced REST API docs with Socket.IO examples
- **Visual Design**: Consistent theming with #f2f2f2 light theme background

### ðŸ”§ Technical Enhancements
- **Performance Optimizations**: Reduced transitions and improved theme switching
- **Component Architecture**: Modular search components with AI integration
- **Layout Fixes**: Resolved gaps, sticky positioning, and responsive design issues
- **Build Warnings**: Fixed missing documentation files and broken links

## Addresses Issue #5234 Requirements

âœ… **Clear Audience Separation**: Distinct tracks for different user types
âœ… **Progressive Disclosure**: Simple â†’ Technical â†’ Advanced progression
âœ… **Visual Learning**: Enhanced UI with glassmorphic design elements
âœ… **Better Navigation**: Streamlined sidebar and navbar organization
âœ… **Technical Deep Dives**: Architecture explanations and development guides
âœ… **Quick Start Experience**: Simplified onboarding for non-technical users

## Technical Changes

### Documentation Structure
- Implemented three-track architecture (Simple, Technical, Customize)
- Updated sidebar configuration with collapsed states
- Enhanced DocItem components with AI assistant integration

### Design System
- Glass morphism effects with proper backdrop blur and transparency
- Optimized color scheme using #f2f2f2 for light theme consistency
- Fixed RSS button styling to match existing GitHub button design
- Improved theme switching performance with reduced transition durations

### Search & Navigation
- Smart search component with AI-powered suggestions
- Enhanced semantic search capabilities using Lunr.js
- Fixed navigation redirects and removed redundant components
- Improved accessibility and keyboard navigation

### Performance & UX
- Reduced motion for users with accessibility preferences
- CSS containment for better rendering performance
- Optimized theme switching with minimal layout shift
- Fixed sidebar gaps and sticky positioning issues

## Files Changed

### Core Documentation Files
- `packages/docs/docs/faq.md` - Comprehensive FAQ updates
- `packages/docs/docs/intro.mdx` - Updated introduction with track navigation
- `packages/docs/docs/simple/intro.md` - New simple track entry point

### Configuration & Structure
- `packages/docs/docusaurus.config.ts` - RSS, AI, and plugin configuration
- `packages/docs/sidebars.ts` - Three-track sidebar architecture
- `packages/docs/package.json` - Updated dependencies and scripts

### Design & Components
- `packages/docs/src/css/custom.css` - Complete design system overhaul
- `packages/docs/src/components/SmartSearch/index.tsx` - AI-powered search
- `packages/docs/src/theme/DocItem/Content/index.js` - AI assistant integration
- `packages/docs/src/theme/Root/index.js` - Optimized navigation and redirects

### API Documentation
- `packages/docs/docs/rest/socket-io-real-time-connection.api.mdx` - Enhanced Socket.IO docs

## Testing

- âœ… All build processes complete successfully
- âœ… Documentation renders correctly across all tracks
- âœ… Search functionality works with both regular and AI-enhanced modes
- âœ… Theme switching performs smoothly without layout shifts
- âœ… RSS feeds and external links function properly
- âœ… Mobile and desktop responsive design verified

## Breaking Changes

None. All changes are additive and maintain backward compatibility with existing documentation links and structure.

## Next Steps

This foundation enables:
1. **Content Migration**: Moving existing docs into appropriate tracks
2. **Template Gallery**: Adding pre-built agent templates
3. **Video Tutorials**: Integration points for multimedia content
4. **Interactive Examples**: Framework for hands-on documentation
5. **Community Contributions**: Clear structure for community-generated content

## Impact

- **Simple Users**: Can now get started in under 5 minutes with clear, focused guidance
- **Developers**: Have access to deep technical documentation and architecture explanations
- **Contributors**: Benefit from improved development workflows and clearer project structure
- **Overall Project**: Professional, polished documentation that matches ElizaOS product quality

This PR represents the foundation for a world-class documentation experience that serves all ElizaOS users effectively.

<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

## Summary by CodeRabbit

* **New Features**
  * Introduced extensive new documentation for ElizaOS, including quick start guides, agent customization tools, platform integration setup (Discord, Telegram, Twitter), plugin development interfaces, and advanced configuration options.
  * Added guides and UI documentation for analytics, validation frameworks, visual customization, feature workshops, and accessibility within the design system.
  * Expanded documentation structure with separate tracks for simple and technical users, and detailed FAQs.

* **Documentation**
  * Added comprehensive API, CLI, and customization documentation, including markdown and MDX files for setup, usage, best practices, and troubleshooting.
  * Enhanced design system docs with guidelines on accessibility, performance, components, implementation, and animation.
  * Updated and improved documentation formatting, structure, and navigation.
  * Added new tags for blog posts and improved environment configuration examples.

* **Style**
  * Improved formatting and consistency across documentation files, including whitespace, headings, and code snippets.

* **Chores**
  * Added new scripts for documentation development and startup.
  * Removed deprecated or redundant configuration and documentation files.

<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

completedItems.title: fix: repeated DM creation on refresh by clearing forceNew state
completedItems.body:
Problem:
Navigating to a chat with { state: { forceNew: true } } caused repeated DM channel creation on page refresh, as location.state persists across reloads in React Router.

What this PR does:

Adds navigate(location.pathname, { re

completedItems.title: fix: prevent global plugin installations
completedItems.body:
## Summary

This PR fixes an issue where plugins could be installed globally when the CLI is running from a global installation, which could cause permission issues and conflicts between projects.

## Changes

- Renamed `getCliDirectory()`
